title: Can changing sound files get you banned?
body:
So I'm an Eve main, and on the /r/EvelynnMains Reddit page someone posted a set of tips. One of these was that Eve makes a little sound when detected by an enemy which can be used to detect invisible or hidden enemies (like Shaco's Q, or someone in an unwarded brush). The tip linked to a YT video which shows how to manipulate the game's sound files so this becomes a very obvious sound (i.e. a siren instead of a nearly inaudible "whoosh").

Just wondering if this [changing the sound files] is against Riot rules, and if it could get you banned?

Thanks :)

replies.body: Changing the sound is bannable, but increasing the sounds volume isn't.
If you dont preach to chat that youre using different sound files then you wont get banned.

This is doubtful. Riot has systems in place that will detect modifications to the client, such as changing a sound file. So even without mentioning the changes to anyone, it would more than likely still result in a ban. It even happens with people who just change splash arts in the client itself, which falls under "use at your own risk" (rather than explicitly banned), so something like changing the audio files of the game itself would *definitely* trigger the system.

It does because it provides an unfair advantage in the game.

TF q makes a sound when it hits, but its so subtle people don't notice it unless they have ludens, if you change that to a loud bang when it hits, he would be able to check every brush no problem and have massive advantage over normal
tfw you disable sound to save fps

I thought as much. I know what I won't be doing xD

Thanks a lot :)

As Talon said, anything that gives you an advantage over other player is not allowed and 100% bannable. 

As far as things that don't, like say changing the voice files to a language not support by your region is technically bannable, though Riot's stance is that it's use at your own risk but they don't actively ban for it.
